com.nutiteq.tasks
Class CancelableThreadPool

java.lang.Object
  com.nutiteq.tasks.CancelableThreadPool

public class CancelableThreadPool
extends java.lang.Object

Special thread pool executor for tasks that support canceling. Also allows tasks to be associated with priorities, with tasks having higher priorities being executed before tasks having lower priorities.

Method Summary
 void cancelAll()
          Cancel all tasks that are queued and not yet started executing.

Get the number of threads currently used in this thread pool.

Returns:
current thread pool size.

setPoolSize

public void setPoolSize(int poolSize)
Set the number of threads used in this thread pool. Default is one.

Parameters:
poolSize - new thread pool size.

Get number of active workers.

Returns:
number of active workers

execute

public void execute(java.lang.Runnable runnable,
                    int priority,
                    java.lang.Object tag)
Execute task with given priority. Associate a custom tag with the task. Tasks will be queued and processed according to priorities.

Parameters:
runnable - task to execute.
tag - tag for the task. Tags can be used to identify tasks later.
priority - task relative priority. Default priority is 0.

execute

public void execute(java.lang.Runnable runnable,
                    int priority)
Execute task with given priority. Tasks will be queued and processed according to priorities.

Parameters:
runnable - task to execute.
priority - task relative priority. Default priority is 0.

execute

public void execute(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
Execute task with default priority. Tasks will be queued and processed according to priorities.

Parameters:
runnable - task to execute.

cancelAll

public void cancelAll()
Cancel all tasks that are queued and not yet started executing. If any queued task is an instance of com.nutiteq.Task, then isCancelable() method is called first to determine if the task can be cancelled. If task can be canceled, then cancel() method is called afterwards.

cancelWithTags

public void cancelWithTags(java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> tags)
Cancel tasks with specified tags that are queued and not yet started executing. If any queued task is an instance of com.nutiteq.Task, then isCancelable() method is called first to determine if the task can be cancelled. If task can be canceled, then cancel() method is called afterwards.

Parameters:
tags - collection of tags to match against task tags. If tags are equal, tasks are cancelled.
